src:
Šola daje kraju življenje
Včasih je pouk na Dolžu potekal zgolj v enem razredu. Krajani ponosni na šolo, ki že sto let povezuje generacije.
01 Nov 2019, 20:49 by Tanja Jakše Gazvoda



Vsak obiskovalec je dobil ličen obesek, spomin na 100 let šole na Dolžu.



Najbolj zaslužni za prireditev ob 100-letnici šole FOTOGRAFIJE: Tanja Jakše Gazvoda



Otroci s podružnice so zapeli šolsko himno.



Šolarji so pokazali, kaj so se naučili.



Franc Zorc, ki je na Dolžu služboval kar 40 let, in Janez Pavlin, ki je tu poučeval nekaj let.



Ravnateljica OŠ Stopiče



Pevke in pevci mešanega pevskega zbora Društva upokojencev Podgorje skupaj pojejo pet let.



Zapel je tudi zbor z matične šole, ki je v Stopičah.


DOLŽ – Sto let mineva, odkar so na Dolžu, kraju pod Gorjanci, v šolske klopi sedli prvi ukaželjni kratkohlačniki. Pisal se je 15. september, razmere za učenje pa so bile za danes nepredstavljive. V enem prostoru kmečke hiše je znanje nabiralo 100 in več otrok, le eno učiteljico so imeli in tako skromno je pouk potekal kar dve desetletji.


Pevke in pevci mešanega pevskega zbora Društva upokojencev Podgorje skupaj pojejo pet let.

Leta 1939 je iz borne učilnice v kmečki hiši sredi vasi zrasla ponosna šola, ki je za vedno spremenila podobo vasi. V šolskem letu 1939/40 je vanjo prvič vstopilo kar 200 otrok, med njimi tudi tisti, ki so bili na Dolž prešolani iz Zajčjega Vrha in Pangrč Grma. Vse je kazalo, da se bo začela uspešno razvijati, a je usoda pred Dolžane postavila nov izziv – komaj zgrajena stavba je med divjanjem vojne leta 1942 pogorela, ostali so le zidovi. To je bil hud udarec, ki je proces izobraževanja za nekaj let prekinil. Opogumljeni z vizijo boljšega povojnega življenja so Podgorci obnovili poslopje šole in v kraj vrnili znanje.


Šolarji so pokazali, kaj so se naučili.

Zgodovina dolške šole je hkrati zgodovina kraja in ljudi, tu so se v znanju kalile mnoge generacije Podgorcev. Šola je tako že celo stoletje središče kulturnega in družabnega življenja v kraju, ki povezuje generacije, je vaško središče, je nosilka kulture in znanja v najširšem pomenu.»Podružnične šole so nekaj čudovitega, ker živijo in dihajo s krajem, sodelovanje s starši je posebno in pristno,« je na prisrčni slovesnosti, ki so jo sooblikovali tako učenci kot učitelji in drugi krajani, izpostavila ravnateljica Mateja Andrejčič, ravnateljica Osnovne šole Stopiče, pod okrilje katere spada podružnična šola Dolž, ena od dveh podružnic stopiške šole, obe vodi Mojca Pavlin.Delo na podružnični šoli je specifično, je drugačno, saj so tu kombinirani oddelki, prvi in drugi razred sta skupaj, tretji in četrti skupaj. »Učitelj mora imeti veliko znanja in kompetenc, da zna povezati vsebine in motivirati otroke, da dosežejo standarde znanja, ki so primerljivi z drugimi šolami. Tu, na Dolžu, jim že vrsto let to odlično uspeva,« je dejala Andrejčičeva.


Otroci s podružnice so zapeli šolsko himno.

Danes šolo na Dolžu obiskuje 35 otrok, 29 jih je vključenih v predšolsko vzgojo, vrtec je namreč v prizidku, 47 otrok iz Krajevne skupnosti Dolž pa obiskuje višje razrede v matični šoli v Stopičah. In razveseljivo je, da se za mladež v teh podgorjanskih krajih ni bati, zadnja leta vpis v vrtec narašča.Na Dolžu so še kako zadovoljni, ker občina Novo mesto, ki je ustanoviteljica šole, zgledno skrbi za svoje objekte, da ceni prednosti podeželske šole in dostopnost izobrazbe v domačem kraju. Tako so leta 2004 dobili prizidek za predšolsko vzgojo, leta 2017 pa je bila stavba celovito energetsko sanirana.»Na občini se zavedajo pomena šole v kraju, čeprav je od matične šole oddaljena le pet kilometrov, od Novega mesta pa le 12. A če je šola v kraju, je tukaj tudi življenje. Šola je kraj, kjer se odvija kulturno in družabno življenje. Nobena prireditev ne mine brez petja in igre otrok ter povezovanja in medgeneracijskega sodelovanja,« je zadovoljna Andrejčičeva.


Najbolj zaslužni za prireditev ob 100-letnici šole FOTOGRAFIJE: Tanja Jakše Gazvoda

Številni ljudje so zaznamovali šolstvo na Dolžu, vsak je prispeval svoj kamenček v mozaiku stoletnice, enega pomembnejših Franc Zorc, dolgoletni upokojeni sodelavec šole, učitelj, upravitelj, pozneje ravnatelj podružnične šole, ki je na Dolžu služboval kar 40 let.Ker je stoletnica hrama učenosti res lep jubilej, so ga na Dolžu praznovali kar ves teden, zaključili pa v petek na prireditvi, ki so jo sooblikovali tako otroci kot učitelji. Predstavil se je mladinski pevski zbor z matične šole iz Stopič pod mentorstvom Alenke Gazvoda, pevke in pevci mešanega pevskega zbora Društva upokojencev Podgorje pod vodstvom Toneta Finka, meh harmonike sta raztegnila Jaka Kobe in Gašper Kralj, navdušil je tudi solist domačin Tom Kobe, doktor dentalne medicine, ki je svojo ljubezen do glasbe nadgradil na Konservatorju za glasbo Jurij Slatkonja Novo mesto.
Nobena prireditev tu ne mine brez petja in igre otrok ter povezovanja in medgeneracijskega sodelovanja.
Ob stoletnici so pripravili priložnostno razstavo, na kateri je bilo na ogled slikovno in drugo arhivsko gradivo iz 100-letne razgibane zgodovine šole, ki jo je zbrala in zasnovala vsestranska učiteljica Suzana Klobučar, ki na dolški šoli poučuje od leta 1997. V Krajevni skupnosti Dolž pripravljajo zbornik, ki bo združeval preteklost in prihodnost teh krajev in ljudi pod Gorjanci. Publikacijo, ki jo ob pomoči številnih domačinov, tudi ljubiteljskega fotografa Joška Šimica iz Črmošnjic, pripravlja Tanja Sluga Kobe, bodo, če bo vse po sreči, predstavili ob kulturnem prazniku.
text:
The school gives the place life
Sometimes classes in Dolj took place in only one class. The locals are proud of the school that has been connecting generations for hundreds of years.
01 Nov 2019, 20:49 by Tanja Jakse Gazvoda



Each visitor received a personal pendant commemorating 100 years of school in Dolj.



Most deserving of the 100th anniversary of the school PHOTOS: Tanja Jakša Gazvoda



The children from the branch sang the school anthem.



Schoolchildren showed what they learned.



Franc Zorc, who worked for 40 years at Dolj, and Janez Pavlin, who taught there for several years.



Director of Stopice Elementary School



The singers and singers of the mixed choir of the Podgorje Pensioners' Association have been singing together for five years.



He also sang a choir from his mother's school in Stopiche.


DOLZ - It has been a hundred years since the first commanding shorts sat in Dolj, a place below Gorjanci. It was written on September 15, and the learning situation was unimaginable for today. In one room of a farmhouse, 100 or more children gained knowledge, only one teacher, and for so modest a lesson lasted for two decades.


The singers and singers of the mixed choir of the Podgorje Pensioners' Association have been singing together for five years.

In 1939, a proud school grew out of a pine classroom in a farmhouse in the middle of the village, forever changing the image of the village. In the 1939/40 school year, as many as 200 children entered the school for the first time, including those who had been transferred to Dolj from Zajčji Vrh and Pangrč Grma. Everything seemed to start to develop successfully, but the fate of the town of Dolžane posed a new challenge - the barely built building burned down during the rampage of the 1942 war, with only walls left. It was a severe blow that interrupted the education process for several years. Encouraged by the vision of a better post-war life, the people of Podgorica restored the school building and brought the knowledge back to the place.


Schoolchildren showed what they learned.

The history of Dolga's school is at the same time the history of the place and the people, where many generations of Podgorians have germinated in the knowledge. For centuries, the school has been the center of cultural and social life in a place that connects for generations, it is a village center, it is the bearer of culture and knowledge in the broadest sense. "Affiliate schools are wonderful because they live and breathe with the place, working with parents is special and authentically, "said Headmaster Mateja Andrejčič, Headmaster of Stopiče Primary School, one of the two Branch Schools, both run by Mojca Pavlin, at a heartfelt ceremony co-designed by both students and teachers and other locals. .The work at the branch school is specific, it is different, as there are combined classes here, the first and second grades are together, the third and fourth are together. “The teacher must have a great deal of knowledge and competence to be able to relate content and motivate children to achieve standards of knowledge that are comparable to other schools. They have been doing a great job here at Dolj, "Andrejčič said.


The children from the branch sang the school anthem.

Today, 35 children are attending school in Dolj, 29 are enrolled in pre-school education, namely kindergarten is being upgraded, and 47 children from the local community of Dolj are attending upper grades at the parent school in Stopići. And it is gratifying that there is no fear for the youth in these suburban areas, the enrollment in kindergarten has been increasing in recent years. They are still satisfied with the debt, because the municipality of Novo mesto, which is the founder of the school, exemplarily takes care of its facilities to appreciate the benefits of a rural school. and the accessibility of home-based education. Thus, in 2004 they received an extension for pre-school education, and the building was comprehensively energy rehabilitated in 2017. "The municipality is aware of the importance of the school in the town, although it is only five kilometers away from the home school and only 12 km away from Novo mesto. school in the place, life is here too. The school is a place where cultural and social life takes place. No event will pass without singing and playing children and networking and intergenerational cooperation, "Andrejčič is pleased.


Most deserving of the 100th anniversary of the school PHOTOS: Tanja Jakša Gazvoda

Many people characterized the education at Dolj, each contributing his pebble in the mosaic of the centenary, one of the most important Franc Zorc, a long-retired associate of the school, a teacher, administrator, and later headmaster of a branch school, who served 40 years at Dolj. a truly beautiful jubilee, it was celebrated all week in Dolj, and concluded on Friday at an event co-designed by both children and teachers. The youth choir from Stopič Primary School presented itself under the mentorship of Alenka Gazvoda, singers and singers of the Podgorje Retirement Singers Choir under the direction of Tone Fink, the accordion accord was stretched by Jaka Kobe and Gasper Kralj, and the soloist Tom Kobe, Doctor of Dental, was also impressed. medicine, who upgraded his love for music at the Yuri Slatkon Music Conservatory Novo mesto.
There is no event here without singing and playing children and networking and intergenerational cooperation.
On the occasion of the centenary, a special exhibition was prepared to display pictorial and other archival material from the 100-year history of the school, collected and designed by the versatile teacher Suzana Klobučar, who has been teaching at the Dolga School since 1997. they are preparing a collection that will unite the past and the future of these places and the people of Gorjanci. The publication, which, with the help of many locals, including amateur photographer Josko Simic from Crmošnjice, is being prepared by Tanja Sluga Kobe, will, if fortunately, be presented on a cultural holiday.
